question: What are the documents required to be submitted before submission deadline? List all of them and indicate how to prepare these docs.
answer:
Mentioned  

The documents that must be submitted before the deadline, and how each should be prepared, are:

1. **Expression of Interest (EOI) form** – The consulting firm (or each partner in a joint venture) must complete the EOI form in English, filling all required fields such as date of establishment, type of organization, address, contact details, former name, and a narrative description of the firm’s relevant experience. The form must be digitally signed and uploaded one by one on the e‑procurement platform. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:8](chunkref://8)  

2. **Supporting documents** – These include brochures, descriptions of similar assignments, evidence of experience, and proof of availability of appropriate staff. If any supporting material is not in English, an English translation must be provided and notarised; otherwise the material will not be considered. All supporting documents must accompany the EOI and be uploaded online. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:3](chunkref://3);[Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4)  

3. **Certificates of experience from clients** – For each assignment listed in Annexure‑IV, the applicant must attach a copy of the client’s certificate confirming the work performed. These certificates should be in English or accompanied by a notarised translation. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:11](chunkref://12)  

4. **Letter of intent or existing agreement (for joint ventures)** – If the applicant is a joint venture, a letter of intent or a copy of the existing JV agreement must be attached, clearly indicating the lead firm and ensuring the JV has no more than three members. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4)  

5. **Undertaking** – The applicant’s President, Managing Director, or authorized signatory must sign an undertaking certifying that all information in the EOI is true and that any misleading information will lead to disqualification. This undertaking must be part of the submission. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:13](chunkref://15)  

6. **Annexure‑IV – Details of Experience** – The applicant must provide a detailed table for each assignment, including assignment name, location, owner’s name and address, completion cost, description of the assignment, and description of services provided. This annexure is part of the EOI package. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:11](chunkref://12)  

7. **Financial statements (last five years)** – The EOI should include the applicant’s financial statements for the last five fiscal years, showing annual turnover from consulting business. These statements must be in English or accompanied by notarised translations. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:9](chunkref://9)  

8. **Compliance with format and completeness** – All documents must be in the required format, complete, and submitted online before the due date and time (July 20, 2020 1500 hrs IST). Incomplete or conditional submissions will not be considered. [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4);[Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:3](chunkref://3)  

**Preparation steps**  
- Gather all required information and documents.  
- Translate any non‑English material into English and have the translations notarised.  
- Fill out the EOI form and Annexure‑IV accurately, ensuring all fields are completed.  
- Attach the supporting documents, certificates, letter of intent (if applicable), undertaking, and financial statements.  
- Digitally sign the EOI and all accompanying documents.  
- Upload each document individually on the e‑procurement portal before the deadline.  

These steps and documents are all derived from the provided context.

Republic of India — The CPMU now invites eligible consulting firms (“consultants”) to indicate their interest
in providing the services.Interested consultants should provide information demonstrating
that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the services
(brochures,description of similar assignments,experience in similar conditions, availability of
appropriate skills among staff,etc.). Key Experts will not be evaluated at the shortlisting
stage. The detailed shortlisting criteria are mentioned in Section II of the EoI. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture to enchance their
Qualifications. The EOI submitted by consultants in association should clearly indicate
the nature of the association if it is a joint venture. In case of Joint venture, the name of
the lead firm should be clearly stated and the JV should not have more than three
members including the lead. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 3.16,3.17: “Conflict of Interest”
and paragraph 3.32: “Fraud & Corruption” of the World Bank’s Procurement Regulations for
IPF Borrowersdated July 2016, revised November 2017 and August 2018, setting forth the
World Bank’s policy. Consultants will be selected in accordance with the Quality and cost Based selection (QCBS
method set out in the Procurment Regulations for IPF Borrowers. The consultant/bidders can
download the Expression of Interest(EoI)comprising‘ShortListingCriteria’and ‘Terms of
Reference from the e‐procurement platform (https://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app) fromMay
22,2020, 1000hrs(IST)onwards.TheBiddersneed to submittheEoI along with all relevant
documents online through eprocurement platform(https://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app). Last
date/time for receipt of bid through e‐procurement is on July 20 ,2020 upto 1500 hrs (IST).
Late and offline bids shall not be accepted.The‘Short Listing Criteria’and‘Scope of Work’are
also available in the DRIP websitehttp://www.damsafety.in. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below from 0930hrsto
1730hrs (Monday to Friday, except Govt. holidays). The office of the Project Director,
DRIP Phase II and Phase III,
Central Water Commmission, 8th Floor, SewaBhawan
R K Puram, N Delhi-110066, India
PhoneNo.:+91-11-26106848,
projectdr.drip-cwc@gov.in

Republic of India — Instruction for submission of Expression of Interest 1. Consultant shall go through the guidelines provided under section‘I’and Section ‘II’before preparing EOI proposal.
2. Consultant who meet shortlisting criteria given in section ‘II’ shall prepare EOI as per the guidelines
given
in
section
I.
If
the
Consultant
desires
to
submit certain information not covered in the guidelines would be in his interest, he
may submit such information.
3. The Application shall be the basis for drawing up a shortlist of eligible consultants who willbeinvitedtosubmitproposalforservicesrequired.
4. All Applications shall be submitted in English.
5. If the EOI is submitted by a Joint Venture, attach a letter of intent or a copy of an existing agreement.
6. The EOI and all related correspondence and documents should be written in the English language.Supporting documents and printed literature furnished by Applicant with the
EOI may be in any other language provided that they are accompanied with translations
in the English language.Supporting materials,which are not translated into English,may
not be considered.For the purpose of interpretation and evaluation of the EOI,the
English language translation shall prevail. The translated documents from any other
language to English language shall be notorised.
7. The Applicant shall provide all the information sought under this shortlisting Criteria.Central
Water
Commission
would
evaluate
only
those
EOI
thatarereceivedintherequiredformatandcompleteinallrespects.Incomplete and / or conditi
onal EOI shall not be considered for short listing.
8. Detailed ToR will also be available on website www.damsafety.in
9. No EOI whatsoever will be entertained if submission is not received online by due date andtime.
10. The Consultant has to digitally sign and upload the required bid documents one by one asindicatedinthetenderdocument.
